purpose.summary: This COBOL program, COPAUA0C, is a Card Authorization Decision Program designed for a CICS COBOL IMS MQ environment. It handles card authorization requests, interacts with IMS databases, and uses MQ for messaging. The program extracts request messages, processes authorization logic, and sends responses via MQ.
purpose.business_context: Card authorization processing within a financial transaction system.

inputs.name: W01-GET-BUFFER
inputs.description: Input message from MQ containing card authorization request details.

inputs.name: IMS Database
inputs.description: IMS database segments containing cardholder account and profile data.

outputs.name: W02-PUT-BUFFER
outputs.description: Output message to MQ containing the card authorization response.

called_programs.purpose: Opens the request queue for reading messages.
Retrieves a message from the request queue.
Sends a reply message to the reply queue.

business_rules.description: If the MQOPEN call fails, log an error.
business_rules.logic_summary: Checks WS-COMPCODE after MQOPEN. If not MQCC-OK, sets error flags and performs 9500-LOG-ERROR.

business_rules.description: If the MQGET call fails due to no message available, set the NO-MORE-MSG-AVAILABLE flag.
business_rules.logic_summary: Checks WS-REASON after MQGET. If MQRC-NO-MSG-AVAILABLE, sets NO-MORE-MSG-AVAILABLE to TRUE.

business_rules.description: If the MQPUT1 call fails, log an error.
business_rules.logic_summary: Checks WS-COMPCODE after MQPUT1. If not MQCC-OK, sets error flags and performs 9500-LOG-ERROR.

transforms.transformation_description: Converts alphanumeric transaction amount to numeric.
Calculates the authorization date by subtracting the Julian date from 99999.
Calculates the authorization time by subtracting the time with milliseconds from 999999999.
Moves authorization ID code to the PA structure.
Moves authorization response code to the PA structure.

copybooks_used.purpose: Defines the structure of the MQ request message (MQM-OD-REQUEST).
Defines the structure of the MQ reply message (MQM-OD-REPLY).
Defines the structure of the MQ message descriptor for the request (MQM-MD-REQUEST).
Defines the structure of the MQ message descriptor for the reply (MQM-MD-REPLY).
Defines the structure of the MQ Get Message Options (MQM-GET-MESSAGE-OPTIONS).
Defines the structure of the MQ Put Message Options (MQM-PUT-MESSAGE-OPTIONS).

paragraphs.purpose: This paragraph opens the MQ request queue, enabling the program to receive authorization requests. It moves the queue name (WS-REQUEST-QNAME) and object type (MQOT-Q) into the MQ object descriptor (MQM-OD-REQUEST). It then computes the options for opening the queue, setting it to input-shared mode. The MQOPEN call is then made, using the connection handle, object descriptor, options, object handle, completion code, and reason code. If the MQOPEN call is successful (WS-COMPCODE = MQCC-OK), the WS-REQUEST-MQ-OPEN flag is set to TRUE. If the call fails, an error is logged using paragraph 9500-LOG-ERROR, including the completion code and reason code. The paragraph consumes WS-REQUEST-QNAME and MQOT-Q as inputs, and produces either a successful queue opening or an error log entry. It calls the MQOPEN program and potentially the 9500-LOG-ERROR paragraph.

This paragraph schedules a PSB (Program Specification Block) for IMS database interaction. It uses the EXEC DLI SCHD command with the PSB-NAME. If the PSB has been scheduled more than once (PSB-SCHEDULED-MORE-THAN-ONCE), it terminates the PSB using EXEC DLI TERM and then reschedules it. The IMS-RETURN-CODE is updated with the DIBSTAT value after each scheduling attempt. This paragraph ensures the program can access the necessary IMS database resources. The paragraph consumes PSB-NAME as input and updates IMS-RETURN-CODE. It calls EXEC DLI SCHD and EXEC DLI TERM. The purpose of scheduling the PSB is to prepare the IMS environment for subsequent database operations related to card authorization processing. Error handling is implicit in the IMS environment, with DIBSTAT providing status information.

This paragraph extracts the card authorization request message from the W01-GET-BUFFER. It uses the UNSTRING statement to parse the message, which is delimited by commas. The extracted data elements are moved into corresponding fields within the PA-RQ-* data structure, such as PA-RQ-AUTH-DATE, PA-RQ-CARD-NUM, and PA-RQ-TRANSACTION-AMT. The alphanumeric transaction amount (WS-TRANSACTION-AMT-AN) is converted to a numeric value (PA-RQ-TRANSACTION-AMT) using the FUNCTION NUMVAL. This paragraph consumes W01-GET-BUFFER and produces the parsed data elements in the PA-RQ-* fields. The purpose is to prepare the request data for subsequent authorization processing. No explicit error handling is shown in the provided code snippet for the UNSTRING operation, but it is assumed that the message format is validated elsewhere.

This paragraph reads a message from the MQ request queue. It sets the MQGMO-OPTIONS for the MQGET call, including MQGMO-NO-SYNCPOINT, MQGMO-WAIT, MQGMO-CONVERT, and MQGMO-FAIL-IF-QUIESCING. It also sets the MQMD fields, such as MSGID and CORRELID. The MQGET call is then made, using the connection handle, object handle, message descriptor, get message options, buffer length, buffer, data length, completion code, and reason code. If the MQGET call is successful (WS-COMPCODE = MQCC-OK), the correlation ID and reply queue name are saved. If the call fails and the reason code is MQRC-NO-MSG-AVAILABLE, the NO-MORE-MSG-AVAILABLE flag is set to TRUE. Otherwise, an error is logged using paragraph 9500-LOG-ERROR. This paragraph consumes the MQ request queue and produces a message in W01-GET-BUFFER. It calls the MQGET program and potentially the 9500-LOG-ERROR paragraph.

This paragraph orchestrates the authorization processing. It first sets the APPROVE-AUTH flag to TRUE. It then schedules the PSB using paragraph 1200-SCHEDULE-PSB. After scheduling the PSB, it sets CARD-FOUND-XREF and FOUND-ACCT-IN-MSTR to TRUE. It then calls several paragraphs to read data: 5100-READ-XREF-RECORD, 5200-READ-ACCT-RECORD, 5300-READ-CUST-RECORD, 5500-READ-AUTH-SUMMRY, and 5600-READ-PROFILE-DATA. These read operations are performed only if CARD-FOUND-XREF is TRUE. This paragraph consumes the request data and produces the authorization decision. It calls 1200-SCHEDULE-PSB and several read paragraphs. The purpose is to gather all necessary data for making an authorization decision based on card and account information. The paragraph assumes that the called paragraphs will handle their own error conditions.

error_handling.condition: WS-COMPCODE not equal to MQCC-OK after MQOPEN
error_handling.action: Log error with location 'M001', set error flags, and perform 9500-LOG-ERROR.

error_handling.condition: WS-COMPCODE not equal to MQCC-OK after MQGET
error_handling.action: Log error with location 'M003', set error flags, and perform 9500-LOG-ERROR.

error_handling.condition: WS-COMPCODE not equal to MQCC-OK after MQPUT1
error_handling.action: Log error with location 'M004', set error flags, and perform 9500-LOG-ERROR.

open_questions.question: What are the exact structures of the MQ message descriptors and options copybooks?
open_questions.context: The copybook names are not provided, making it impossible to determine the precise layout of the MQ structures.
open_questions.suggestion: Locate the copybooks (e.g., MQM-MD-REQUEST, MQM-OD-REQUEST, MQM-GET-MESSAGE-OPTIONS) to understand the message formats.

open_questions.question: What is the purpose and implementation of the 9500-LOG-ERROR paragraph?
open_questions.context: This paragraph is called in several error handling routines, but its code is not included in the sampled source.
open_questions.suggestion: Examine the full source code to understand how errors are logged and handled.

open_questions.question: What are the specific IMS database segments accessed by the read paragraphs (5100-5600)?
open_questions.context: The code only shows the paragraph calls, not the actual IMS database operations.
open_questions.suggestion: Examine the full source code to determine the IMS segment names and access patterns.

dead_code.name: 9500-EXIT
dead_code.reason: Paragraph '9500-EXIT' is never PERFORMed or referenced by any other paragraph or program

dead_code.name: 9990-EXIT
dead_code.reason: Paragraph '9990-EXIT' is never PERFORMed or referenced by any other paragraph or program
